channel.title: RSCD Droprate?
channel.description:
Yeh the topic say it most...
But how is the droprate working in RSCD?
Weight><Weight how is the system working, to get like 1 dsq drop every 6k kbd etc?
Dunno what is rarely and what is not rarely drop rate.....
please help with this!

item.title: RSCD Droprate?
item.dc:creator: @xT-e xT-e
item.description:
@xT-e wrote:

[quote=“dear god, post:6, topic:246139”]say you want the kbd to drop 3 things, thing one and 2 are rare while 3 isnt.

you make them all = 100. so thing 3 = 98, 1 = 1, 2 = 1.[/quote]

What god means is:
say you want coins to drop 95 times out of 100 kills
make coins = 95 so that there is a 95% chance of it dropping
then make d long = 3 so that there is a 3% chance of a drop
and d axe = 2 sp there is a 2% of axe dropping

work with making everything add up too 100, or sums of 100, up to around 1000, so it is easier to calculate the percentage that the items drops.

Read full topic

item.description:
@dear_god1 wrote:

say you want the kbd to drop 3 things, thing one and 2 are rare while 3 isnt.

you make them all = 100. so thing 3 = 98, 1 = 1, 2 = 1.

hmm, if i have add Dmed, Dsq, Dragon baxe, Dlong and Dragon Bones into a Black dragon… and i want dmed drop every 6k dsq every 8k dragon baxe every 3k dlong every 1k etc? how i do ?

item.title: RSCD Droprate?
item.dc:creator: @dear_god1 dear god
item.description:
@dear_god1 wrote:

The higher the number is, the heavier it is. Meaning it drops more. If you want 1 dsq drop every 6k kbd. Make the total weight of all it’s drops 6000 with the dsq being 1.

I probably didn’t explain it very well, sorry if this didn’t help.

Read full topic
